alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Rawlins (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 10:57PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rawlins and southwestern Decatur Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1057 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Selden, or 14 miles southwest of Oberlin, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Rawlins and southwestern Decatur Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
